Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice Advance Online Articles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;a50a7ef5.1502</link>   <description> New Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice Advance Online<br>articles available.<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccjAO&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccjAO<br><br>Determinants of Police Strength in Canadian Cities: Assessing the Impact of<br>Minority Threat<br><br>Rick Ruddell and Matthew O. Thomas<br><br>The minority threat proposition posits that the size of minority populations<br>is positively associated with levels of formal social control. Recent<br>research in other nations has shown a clear and consistent relationship<br>between the size of subordinate populations and the number of police as well<br>as increased law enforcement spending. This study examined the<br>relationships, in Canada's largest cities, between six indicators of<br>minority populations and both [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T13:21:01-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;a50a7ef5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;3d582f8e.1501">   <title>University of Toronto Law Journal 65.1 is now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;3d582f8e.1501</link>   <description> Now available online...<br><br>University of Toronto Law Journal - Volume 65, Number 1, Winter 2015<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utlj571&gt; http://bit.ly/utlj571<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>The stripping of the trust: A study in legal evolution<br><br>Adam S Hofri-Winogradow<br><br>The law of trusts has spent the last twenty years rapidly shedding many<br>traditional requirements, forms, and restrictions which imposed liability on<br>negligent trustees, protected vulnerable beneficiaries, and prevented the<br>use of trusts to avoid the claims of settlors' and beneficiaries' creditors,<br>including their spouses, their children, and their governments. This article<br>studies seven aspects of this 'stripping of the trust,' examines its<br>consequences from both a [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T14:05:56-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;3d582f8e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;da708845.1501">   <title>Now available at University of Toronto Law Journal Advance online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;da708845.1501</link>   <description> Now available at University of Toronto Law Journal Advance online...<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utljao&gt; http://bit.ly/utljao<br><br>Victim Impact Statements at Sentencing: Towards A Clearer Understanding of<br>Their Aims<br><br>Marie Manikis<br><br>The Fault of Trespass<br><br>Avihay Dorfman and Assaf Jacob<br><br>The Stripping of the Trust: A Study In Legal Evolution<br><br>Adam S Hofri-Winogradow<br><br>Living Originalism<br><br>Paul Daly<br><br>List and Pettit on Group Agency and Group Responsibility [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T15:05:32-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;da708845.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;74ea4341.1501">   <title>January UTP Journals Law & Criminology Newsletter </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;74ea4341.1501</link>   <description> Don't miss the January UTP Journals Law &amp; Cette mesure peut \ufffd\ufffdtre d\ufffd\ufffdfinie selon : le revenu, le<br>niveau de supervision, l\ufffd\ufffdautonomie et les comp\ufffd\ufffdtences. En se basant sur des<br>entrevues aupr\ufffd\ufffds de d\ufffd\ufffdlinquants incarc\ufffd\ufffdr\ufffd\ufffds (n = 133), cette \ufffd\ufffdtude \ufffd\ufffdvalue si<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T13:32:08-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;7d905435.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;e31d709.1501">   <title>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law 26.2 now available on Project MUSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;e31d709.1501</link>   <description> Now available on Project MUSE \ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law/Revue Femmes et Droit<br><br>Volume 26, Number 2, October 2014<br><br>http://bit.ly/cjwl262pm<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Does the System of Judicial Appointment Matter? Exploring Women\ufffd\ufffds<br>Representation on Ontario\ufffd\ufffds Courts<br><br>Erin Crandall<br><br>Eloquent (In)action: Enforcement and Prosecutorial Restraint in the<br>Transnational Trade in Human Eggs As Deep Ambivalence about the Law [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-05T09:57:02-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;e31d709.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;889fd502.1412">   <title>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law 26.2 now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;889fd502.1412</link>   <description> Now available online \ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Women and the Law/Revue Femmes et Droit<br><br>Volume 26, Number 2, October 2014<br><br>http://bit.ly/cjwl262<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Does the System of Judicial Appointment Matter? Exploring Women\ufffd\ufffds<br>Representation on Ontario\ufffd\ufffds Courts<br><br>Erin Crandall<br><br>Using an original dataset of appointments to Ontario\ufffd\ufffds provincial and<br>superior courts from 1972 to 2012, this article explores whether the system<br>of judicial appointment affects the representation of women on the bench. In<br>addition to providing a comprehensive review of judicial appointments in<br>Ontario, the article finds that since the introduction of new judicial<br>appointments systems by the federal and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-19T10:20:36-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;889fd502.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;26633566.1411">   <title>Mailing tomorrow - November UTP Journals Law & Criminology Newsletter </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;26633566.1411</link>   <description> Don't miss the November UTP Journals Law &amp; Criminology Newsletter - mailing<br>tomorrow!<br><br>Sign up for the free monthly UTP Journals Law and Criminology newsletter!<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter&gt; http://bit.ly/lawnewsletter<br><br>Receive the latest information on newly published research, reviews and<br>opinions as well as Calls for papers and exclusive discounts. Its focus is evidence-based CPTED and Designing Out Crime. The foreword is by Paul Ekblom.<br><br>Full title is Think Crime! Using Evidence, Theory and Crime Prevention through Environmental Design (CPTED) for Planning Safer Cities [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-20T05:15:38+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Terence Love</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;76aa64a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;a3678d13.1410">   <title>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice 56.5 now available on Project MUSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;a3678d13.1410</link>   <description> Now available on Project MUSE\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/<br>La Revue canadienne de criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 56, Number 5, October 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/cjccj565pm&gt; http://bit.ly/cjccj565pm<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Aboriginal People and Confidence in the Police<br><br>Liqun Cao<br><br>\ufffd\ufffdpisodes d’inactivit\ufffd\ufffd et revenus criminels dans une trajectoire de<br>d\ufffd\ufffdlinquance1<br><br>Fr\ufffd\ufffdd\ufffd\ufffdric Ouellet, Pierre Tremblay<br><br>A Case Study of the Transformative Effect of Peer Injection Drug Users in<br>the Downtown Eastside of Vancouver, Canada [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-15T10:49:13-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;a3678d13.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;c18c5d12.1410">   <title>University of Toronto Law Journal 64.5 is now available online </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;c18c5d12.1410</link>   <description> Now available online...<br><br>University of Toronto Law Journal - Volume 64, Number 5, 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/utlj645&gt; http://bit.ly/utlj645<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Strange bedfellows<br><br>Robert Leckey<br><br>This article addresses important, neglected questions of legal craft in<br>relation to rights challenges to legislation, especially equality claims. It<br>considers the perspective from which to assess multiple parts of a complex<br>scheme in a challenge under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms. Is<br>the challenge best framed against the scheme as a whole \ufffd\ufffd all or nothing \ufffd\ufffd<br>or against the separate parts? The framing or perspective can have serious<br>implications for the outcome. Furthermore, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T10:48:47-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>UTP Journals</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;c18c5d12.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;ee1b2164.1410">   <title>New from Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=FEAR-OF-CRIME-RESEARCH;ee1b2164.1410</link>   <description> Now available online\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Canadian Journal of Criminology and Criminal Justice/<br>La Revue canadienne de criminologie et de justice p\ufffd\ufffdnale<br><br>Volume 56, Number 5, October 2014<br><br>&lt;http://bit.ly/CJCCJ56_5&gt; http://bit.ly/CJCCJ56_5<br><br>This issue contains:<br><br>Aboriginal People and Confidence in the Police<br><br>Liqun Cao<br><br>No nationally representative study has been conducted about differential<br>confidence in the police between Aboriginal people and non-Aboriginal<br>persons in Canada. Based on the 2009 General Social Survey of Canada, this<br>article examines the influence of Aboriginal status on confidence in the<br>police.
